intro: Clinogyne filipes, commonly known as the slender-leaved clinogyne, is a herbaceous plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Clinogyne filipes typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky areas. It is a relatively rare species, with limited distribution and specific ecological requirements.
